Shaw University Data & Information Overview

6 awards Ranking BadgesGreat Price Value for Your Money65% Acceptance Rate

If you want to know more about Shaw University, such as what majors does it offer, how diverse it is, how well it ranks, and more, this is your one-stop resource.

If youâre interested in learning more about a particular stat, just click on its tile to go to a new page that covers the topic more in-depth. Also, you can jump to any section of this page by clicking one of the links below.

RankingsAdmission and AcceptanceFacultyRetention and Graduation RatesDiversityCostStudent DebtAverage EarningsLocationMajorsOnline Learning

How Well Is Shaw University Ranked?

#2,173 Best Colleges in Nation#92 Best Colleges in NCPublic Administration & Social Service Highest Ranked Major

2024 Rankings

College Factual recognizes the best colleges and universities in its annual rankings. These rankings include categories for best overall colleges, best colleges for each major, best value schools, and much more.

Shaw University was awarded 6 badges in the 2024 rankings. The highest ranked major at the school is public administration & social service.

Explore Best Ranked Schools for You

Explore the best ranked schools for the programs you are most interested in.

I WANT TO STUDYChoose a study areaArt & DesignBusiness & ManagementComputers & TechnologyCriminal Justice & LegalEducation & TeachingLiberal Arts & HumanitiesNursing & HealthcarePsychology & CounselingScience & EngineeringTrades & CareersUndecided/GeneralMAJORING INChoose an majorWITH A FOCUS INChoose an emphasis (optional)

Overall Quality

Shaw University landed the #2,173 spot in College Factual's 2024 ranking of best overall colleges in the United States. The higher ed experts analyzed 2,217 colleges and universities across the nation to determine this ranking. This is an improvement over the previous year, when Shaw University held the #2,202 spot on the Best Overall Colleges list.

Shaw University is also ranked #92 out of 93 schools in North Carolina.

See all of the rankings for Shaw University.

Is It Hard to Get Into Shaw University?

65% Acceptance Rate61% Of Accepted Are Women

Acceptance Rate

Shaw University has an acceptance rate of 65%, which means the school is serious about who it admits. Take your time in putting together a strong application that highlights why you are a good fit for Shaw University.

Learn more about Shaw University admissions.

Shaw University Faculty

15 to 1 Student to Faculty46% Full Time Teachers

Student to Faculty Ratio

With a student to faculty ratio of 15 to 1, Shaw University is about average in this regard as the nationwide rate is 15 to 1. While this does not translate directly to class size, it's a good indicator of how much time professors will have to spend with their students on a one-on-one basis.

Percent of Full-Time Faculty

In addition to the student to faculty ratio, some people look at what percentage of faculty members are full-time as a sign of how much time professors will be able to spend with their students. This is because part-time teachers may not be be on campus as much as their full-time counterparts.

The full-time faculty percentage at Shaw University is 46%. This is comparable to the national average of 47%.

Full-Time Faculty Percent Â 46 out of 100

Retention and Graduation Rates at Shaw University

58% Freshmen Retention8% On-Time Graduation Rate

Freshmen Retention Rate

The freshmen retention rate is a sign of how many full-time students like a college or university well enough to come back for their sophomore year. At Shaw University this rate is 58%, which is a bit lower than the national average of 68%.

Freshmen Retention Rate Â 58 out of 100

Graduation Rate

When we say that a student has graduated on time, we mean that they have finished their bachelor's degree within four years. The on-time graduation rate at Shaw University is 8%. That's lower than the national rate of 33.3%

On-Time Graduation Rate Â 8 out of 100

Find out more about the retention and graduation rates at Shaw University.

Shaw University Undergraduate Student Diversity

1,048 Full-Time Undergraduates77.5% Racial-Ethnic Minorities*57.7% Percent Women

During the 2017-2018 academic year, there were 1,152 undergraduates at Shaw University with 1,048 being full-time and 104 being part-time.

How Much Does Shaw University Cost?

$23,809 Net Price70% Take Out Loans$24,452 Total Student Loans

The overall average net price of Shaw University is $23,809. The affordability of the school largely depends on your financial need since net price varies by income group. See the table below for the net price for different income groups.

Net Price by Income Group for Shaw University

The net price is calculated by adding tuition, room, board and other costs and subtracting financial aid.Note that the net price is typically less than the published for a school. For more information on the sticker price of Shaw University, see our tuition and fees and room and board pages.

Student Loan Debt

Almost 66% of college students who graduated with the class of 2018 took out student loans, but that percentage varies from school to school. At Shaw University, approximately 70% of students took out student loans averaging $6,113 a year. That adds up to $24,452 over four years for those students.

The student loan default rate at Shaw University is 25.1%. Watch out! This is significantly higher than the national default rate of 10.1%, which means you could have trouble paying back your student loans if you take any out.

Get more details about paying for Shaw University.

How Much Money Do Shaw University Graduates Make?

$32,549 Avg Salary of GradsHigh Earnings Boost

Although some majors pay more than others, students who graduate from Shaw University with a bachelor's degree go on to jobs where they make an average salary of $32,549 in their early years. Unfortunately, this is 23% less that the average college graduate's salary of $42,485 per year. However, graduates in your major field may make more.

See which majors at Shaw University make the most money.

Location of Shaw University

North Carolina State1,048 Full-Time UndergraduatesLarge City Campus Setting

Shaw University is a private not-for-profit institution located in Raleigh, North Carolina. Raleigh is a great location for students who prefer city over country life.

Get more details about the location of Shaw University.

Contact details for Shaw University are given below.

Shaw University Majors

23 Majors With Completions165 Undergraduate Degrees26 Graduate Degrees

During the most recent year for which we have data, students from 23 majors graduated from Shaw University. Of these students, 165 received undergraduate degrees and 26 graduated with a master's or doctor's degree. The following table lists the most popular undergraduate majors along with the average salary graduates from those majors make.

Learn more about the majors offered at Shaw University along with which ones have the highest average starting salaries.

Online Learning at Shaw University

61% Take At Least One Class Online19% Take All Classes Online

Online learning options are becoming more and more popular at American colleges and universities. Online classes are great for students who have busy schedules or for those who just want to study on their own time.

In 2020-2021, 694 students took at least one online class at Shaw University. This is a decrease from the 729 students who took online classes the previous year.

Learn more about online learning at Shaw University.

This number is then divided by the total number of students at the school to obtain the racial-ethnic minorities percentage.
